CatDescriptText: Miss Loretta Jones, 1616 Webster Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the police department states more raids in Negro neighborhoods than in white areas, because there is more crime in former districts?" answer reads: "I think it's because there are more crimes in the Negro neighborhoods."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Loretta Jones wearing eyeglasses, earrings, and striped sleeveless dress, standing with hands clasped on corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, May Building with Thrift Drugs in background, Downtown
